## Run dockerized DBpedia Spotlight

The docker containers are not available for all architectures. Particularly not for M1. Therefore, we need to build from the dockerfile as follows.

```{sh, eval = FALSE}
git clone https://github.com/dbpedia-spotlight/spotlight-docker.git
cd spotlight-docker
docker build -t dbpedia/dbpedia-spotlight:latest
```

Then run the image as follows.

```{sh}
docker run -tid --restart unless-stopped --name dbpedia-spotlight.de --mount source=spotlight-model,target=/opt/spotlight -p 2222:80 dbpedia/dbpedia-spotlight spotlight.sh de
```


## Using the package

```{r}
library(dbpedia)
library(polmineR)
use("polmineR")

sample_speeches <- corpus("GERMAPARL2") %>% 
  subset(protocol_date == "2018-02-22") %>%
  subset(speaker_name == "Angela Merkel") %>%
  subset(p_type == "speech") %>%
  as.speeches(
    s_attribute_name = "speaker_name",
    s_attribute_date = "protocol_date",
    progress = FALSE
  )

sample_speech <- sample_speeches[[1]]

dbpedia_links <- get_dbpedia_links(x = sample_speech, language = "de")

read(sample_speech) %>%
  highlight(highlight = dbpedia_links[["highlight"]]) %>%
  tooltips(tooltips = dbpedia_links[["uri"]]) %>%
  href(url = dbpedia_links[["uri"]])
```
